title: Kirchhoff junction - 4 resistors - current in R3

content.question: Four resistors and a battery are connected in a circuit, as shown in the figure. The currents in three branches within the circuit are labeled, and four junctions <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi></math>, <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> are labeled as well. What is the current in resistor <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.1 amp" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.3 amp" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.5 amp" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>
<math alttext="0.7 amp" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.7</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="0.1 amp" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
